newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: S&P's takes Sun Alliance NZ off creditwatch neg.
newsitem.headline: S&P's takes Sun Alliance NZ off creditwatch neg.

text.p: Standard and Poor's on Friday said it had affirmed its 'AA-' claims-paying ability (CPA) rating of New Zealand's Sun Alliance Insurance Ltd and Sun Alliance General Insurance Company Ltd.
It also removed the ratings from CreditWatch with negative implications, where they were placed on May 6.
The move follows similar action in relation to the British parent Royal and Sun Alliance Insurance Group PLC (RSA), formerly Sun Alliance Group Plc.
S&P said the rating of Sun Alliance was based on its solid business profile, excellent underwriting performance, strong financial structure, and financially strong and supportive ownership by RSA.
Moderating features were the competitive nature of the New Zealand market and the company's high cost structure.

S&P said it expects Sun Alliance to report another sizeable underwriting profit in 1996. It said commission levels should remain constant, but expense levels should fall due to productivity initiatives.
